availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jonathan Hobson Price (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, attorney)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, attorney. Warren County, Kentucky, native. Son of William Price. Deputy sheriff in Jefferson County from 1856 to 1860. Partner with Robert F. Baird in Baird & Price law firm in Louisville from 1860 to 1878.

ab.bibl:
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport – Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Roll #7007127, Louisville Deaths, p. 285-86.
Edwards' Annual Director to the Inhabitants, Institutions, Incorporated Companies, Manufacturing Establishments, Business firms, Etc., Etc., in the City of Louisville, For 1865-6 (Louisville: Edwards, Greenough & Deved, 1866), p. 484.
John Petrie, “Noted Characters Memorable to Louisville: Jonathan Hobson Price,” Louisville Courier-Journal, March 19, 1916, C1.
